critique: This document establishes a Deficit Reduction Fund to ensure that deficit reduction achieved by the Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1993 is dedicated to reducing the deficit. It requires the Director of the Office of Management and Budget to report annually on the status of the fund. There is no direct impact on immigration, executive power, federalism, national security vs. civil liberties, or social inclusion. The document seems fiscally conservative in its aim to reduce the deficit, but it doesn't express a broader ideological stance. It could be seen as moderate intervention in the economy by earmarking funds.
